column2: NORTH CAROLINA DMV DRIVING TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way
column8: Merging traffic
column10: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 2. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column6: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column8: One-way traffic

column2: 4. This sign means:
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column8: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column8: Hospital parking ahead

column2: 6. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column8: Curve ahead

column2: 8. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: all vehicles must turn left immediately.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column8: “Y” intersection ahead
column10: A road joins from the right

column2: 10. These are:
column8: route signs.

column2: 11. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column8: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 12. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to hit a reindeer.
column6: watch for this species crossing the road.
column8: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.

column2: 13. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column8: use your brake lights.
column10: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.

column2: 14. If you get 12 points within 3 years:
column4: an updated driver's handbook is sent, and you must study it within 2 weeks of receipt.
column8: a warning letter is sent.

column2: 15. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
column6: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column10: try pumping it to increase pressure.

column2: 16. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.

column2: 17. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
column8: on an up-hill.

column2: 18. When driving on a wet road:
column4: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column6: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.
column8: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.
column10: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.

column2: 19. Roads are most slippery:
column4: when it first starts to rain.
column8: on hills.

column2: 20. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column8: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 21. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column6: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.
column8: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

column2: 22. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column8: A stop sign.

column2: 23. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column6: Only if the light is green.
column8: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column10: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.

column2: 24. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column6: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
column8: Listen to heavy metal music.

column2: 25. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column8: green, red and yellow.

column2: 26. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: go to the next entrance ramp.

column2: 27. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column6: The bus is about to stop.
column8: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column10: You must pass the school bus.

column2: 28. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column8: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column2: 29. Your BAC depends on:
column8: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 30. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the left edge of the road.
column6: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column8: on the left shoulder of the road.

column2: 31. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 32. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: increase your speed and move to the left.
column6: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column10: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 33. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 34. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column8: parking lights.

column2: 35. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column8: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.
column10: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.

column2: 36. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column8: red, yellow and green

column2: 37. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column4: even if they are short sighted.
column8: BEFORE you move.
